attributes.action: Ask the BBC to show evidence that the person they interviewed on BBC radio is President Yar-Adua of Nigeria
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The president of Nigeria Umaru Yar-Adua is said to be hospitalised since 23/11/2009 in a Saudi hospital and has not been seen since. He did not hand over to the Vice President in line with the Nigerian constitution leaving the country in a leadership vacuum. The terrorist incident involving a Nigerian was reported and issues about the Budget for 2009 were left unattended with rumours that the President was dead. Amidst growing calls for Yar-Adua to hand-over to his Vice, the BBC aired an ‘interview’ with a ‘President Yar-Adua’ (http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/8453321.stm). There is no evidence that the person the BBC spoke to is indeed President Yar-Adua. The BBC neither asked ‘Yar-Adua’ any questions relating to the terrorist incident nor the calls for him to handover to his Vice in spite of ‘Yar-Adua’ been vague on his return date. Rather a message to the football team is aired which is gross insensitivity to the plight of the people. The BBC must show video or photo evidence of the Yar-Adua they spoke to else the BBC stand accused of using tax payers’ money to stage an ignoble drama to provide an escape route for a power hungry African leader.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the BBC, not Government.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
